meanings.definition: The quality of being hot; high temperature.
meanings.sent1: The summer sun brings intense heat to the beach.
meanings.sent2: She placed her cold hands near the fire to warm them up from the heat.
meanings.sent3: The heat from the oven made the cookies bake faster.
meanings.sent4: The heat of the argument could be felt throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The heat of the bonfire warmed everyone's faces.

meanings.definition: A source of warmth or energy.
meanings.sent1: The campfire provided much-needed heat on the chilly night.
meanings.sent2: The heater in the house broke, leaving them without any heat.
meanings.sent3: The heat from the sun powered the solar panels on the roof.
meanings.sent4: The heat from the engine kept the car running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The heat from the fireplace filled the room with a cozy warmth.

meanings.sent1: The heat of anticipation filled the room before the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The heat of competition spurred the athletes to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The heat of the moment led to an unexpected confession.
meanings.sent4: The heat of the crowd's cheers motivated the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The heat of the music festival energized the attendees.
